title: Plotting trajectories
text: order get sample trajectory data, can use trrrj package datasets: flts: 41 flights FR24 2017-02-05 2017-02-05, check documentation via ?flts poss: ADS-B positions reports flts, check documentation via ?poss cprs: CPR’s matching flts, check documentation via ?cprs now plot ADS-B positions just one flight, flight RYR19QK Comiso Malpensa: can now plot ADS-B trajectory: 2D plot via ggmap one CPRs: 2D plot via ggmap can also see vertical profiles vs distance (ADS-B trajectory): Flight’s vertical profile vs. distance time: Flight’s vertical profile vs. time Now let’s plot CPR trajectories (automatic bounding box): map sample CPR trajectories
code: europe <- c(left = 5, bottom = 35, right = 30, top = 52)  # let's just focus on 1 flight trj_adsb <- poss %>%   dplyr::filter(flight_id == 207752905)  trrrj::plot_flight_horizontal(trj_adsb, bbox = europe) trj_cpr <- cprs %>%    filter(callsign == "RYR19QK")  trj_cpr %>%    trrrj::plot_cpr_horizontal(europe, linewidth = 1.3, colour = "blue") plot_flight_vertical_distance(trj_adsb %>% cumulative_distance()) plot_flight_vertical_time(trj_adsb %>% cumulative_time()) cprs %>%   plot_cpr_horizontal(linewidth = 1.3)

title: Plotting trajectories
text: pruatlas package provides base map Europe using Lambert Azimuthal Equal-Area projection. useful package extend plotting trajectories. PRU’s github account, euctrl-pru/pruatlas.

what: Retrive FR24 ADS-B data from DB
title: Plotting trajectories
text: trrrj package provides API retrieve FR24 data DB. use case flights around airport. continuing CAREFUL use , get lot data back il take lot time. Let’s say want retrieve arrival flow Stavanger airport Norway 6th Sep 2017, need issue following command (showing first 10 ones ): Arrival flights Stavanger airport, Norway, Sep 6, 2017 (10 ) get position reports 40 NM around airport flights (showing first 10 ones): prepare data plot:
code: svg20170906flt <- export_flights_at_airport_fr24("2017-09-06T00:00:00Z",                                                  "2017-09-07T00:00:00Z",                                                  "SVG",                                                  flow = "ARR") # fake the ROracle call load(file = paste0(here::here(), "/data/flts.rda"))  svg20170906flt <-  flts %>%   as_tibble() %>%   filter(real_to == "BRU")  knitr::kable(   head(svg20170906flt, 10),   caption = "Arrival flights at Stavanger airport, Norway, on Sep 6, 2017 (10 only)") library(trrrj) # TODO: handle the case when building w/ Oracle DB svg20170906pos <- export_flights_at_airport_fr24(   "2017-09-06", "2017-09-07",   "SVG", 5.638, 58.877,   flow = "ARR",   radius = 40) # knitr::kable(head(svg20170906pos, 10)) svg20170906pos <- svg20170906pos %>%    rename(longitude = LON, latitude = LAT) %>%    mutate(longitude = as.numeric(longitude), latitude = as.numeric(latitude))  svg20170906flt <- svg20170906flt %>%    rename(callsign = CALLSIGN)  svg20170906pos <- svg20170906pos %>%    left_join(svg20170906flt)  plot_flight_horizontal(svg20170906pos)

title: Plotting trajectories
text: FR24 archive files can accessed standard R tools like readr retrieve flight list companion sample files package: first 10 entries (variables omitted): sample FR24 flight data available flts dataset package. See also relevant help page, ?flts.
code: library(trrrj) library(dplyr) library(purrr) library(readr)  ######## flights flights_dir <- system.file("extdata", package = "trrrj") flights_csvs <- dir(flights_dir, pattern = "201702.._flights\\.csv", full.names = TRUE) flights <-  purrr::map_df(flights_csvs, read_csv)

title: Plotting trajectories
text: trrrj package provides helpes read position report files FR24 archive data feed. order read ADS-B position reports days previous section: first 10 entries (variables omitted) flight “AIC175” (flight_id = 207507520) : sample FR24 ADS-B position report data available poss dataset package. See also relevant help page, ?poss.
code: ######## positions poss_dirs <- c("20170206_positions", "20170205_positions") poss_dirs <- system.file("extdata", poss_dirs, package = "trrrj") poss_csvs <- dir(poss_dirs, pattern = "201702.._.*\\.csv", full.names = TRUE) positions <- purrr::map_dfr(poss_csvs, read_positions_fr24)  # augment with flight info positions <- positions %>%   left_join(flights, by = "flight_id") %>%   filter(!is.na(callsign), callsign != "YELLOW6")

title: Plotting trajectories
text: trrrj package provides facilities read NM’s archived CPR files. order import cprs 2 demo days: show first 10 entries (variables omitted) flight, “AIC175”, ADS-B positions: sample NM’s CPR’s data available cprs dataset package. See also relevant help page, ?cprs.
code: # read all 5th and 6th February 2017 CPR's files # cprs_dirs <- system.file("extdata", package = "trrrj") # cprs_delims <- dir( #    cprs_dirs, #    pattern = "1.2017020.1001tacop304ARCHIVED_OPLOG_ALL_CPR\\.gz", #    full.names = TRUE) cprs_delims <- c(   trrrj_example("1.201702051001tacop304ARCHIVED_OPLOG_ALL_CPR.gz"),   trrrj_example("1.201702061001tacop304ARCHIVED_OPLOG_ALL_CPR.gz"))  poss_cpr <- purrr::map_dfr(cprs_delims, read_cpr)

title: Flight trajectories analysis
text: WORK PROGRESS: use risk. trrrj package provides facilities aid analysis flight trajectories. contiuous flux new features added also users’ feedback. want contribute feel overwhelmed git/github scaffolding, please look usethis vignette “Pull request helpers”. marvellously describes nice workflow make collaboration easy fruitful.

title: Flight trajectories analysis
text: trrrj yet available CRAN, can install development version github :

title: Flight trajectories analysis
text: functions allow : Flightradar24’s archived/live feed files (ADS-B) Flightradar24’s live feed EUROCONTROL’s DB (ADS-B) Network Manager’s archived CPR files (see CPRs Notes) DDR2’s SO6 trajectories EUROCONTROL’s DB (Flight plan CPR based) OpenSky Network’s historical data, removed see osn package 2D plot vertical profiles (time distance based) extract level flight segments parse Longitude/Latitude various formats determine AIRAC cyle date range (ICAO CFMU format); see AIRAC Notes

what: Aircraft type as per ICAO. — aircrafttype
title: Aircraft type as per ICAO. — aircrafttype
text: dataset containing aircraft types "published" ICAO's Aicraft Type Designator page.

title: Aircraft type as per ICAO. — aircrafttype
Aircraft type as per ICAO. — aircrafttype
text: data frame 9290 rows 19 variables. variables joint flight information flts following ones: ModelFullName Full name aircraft model Description Description aircraft type. first character L = landplane, S = seaplane, = amphibian, H = helicopter, G = gyrocopter, T = tilt-wing aircraft. second character number engines 1 thru 8 C applicable fixed-wing aircraft indicating two engines coupled drive single propeller system. fird character type engine P = piston engine, T = turboprop/turboshaft engine, J = jet engine, E = electric engine WTC Wake Turbulence Category (WTC) indicator defined according certificated maximum take-mass (MTOM). H = heavy (300000 lb), M = medium (less 136000 kg (300000 lb) 7000 kg (15500 lb)) Designator aircraft type designator ManufacturerCode aircraft manufacturer code AircraftDescription aircraft kind, see first character Description field. EngineCount number engines, see second character Description field. EngineType engine type, see third character Description field.

title: Aircraft type as per ICAO. — aircrafttype
text: https://www.icao.int/publications/DOC8643/Pages/Search.aspx

what: Sample Correlated Position Report (CPR) data. — cprs
title: Sample Correlated Position Report (CPR) data. — cprs
text: dataset containing CPR's 41 flights flying Europe. One 4th , 19 5th 21 6th Feb 2017.

title: Sample Correlated Position Report (CPR) data. — cprs
Sample Correlated Position Report (CPR) data. — cprs
text: data frame 53940 rows 10 variables: cpm_id CPR Message (CPM) line number tact_id TACT Id, TACT (.k.. ETFMS) NM system timestamp_etfms time CPM reception ETFMS system timestamp_track time track block block number. ETFMS internal use record record number. ETFMS internal use entry_node_sac Entry Node (EN) system area code (SAC). avoid ambiguity exchange Surveillance related data, system using ASTERIX data format gets assigned unique identifier composed two values called SAC/SIC. See https://www.eurocontrol.int/services/system-area-code-list entry_node_sic Entry Node (EN) system identifier code (SIC). avoid ambiguity exchange Surveillance related data, system using ASTERIX data format gets assigned unique identifier composed two values called SAC/SIC. System Identification Code (SIC) allocated nationally responsible Air Traffic Services Organisation. identifies individual system (surveillance sensor, surveillance data processing system, etc) within respective area defined SAC. See https://www.eurocontrol.int/services/system-area-code-list callsign Callsign flight provided FPL (Flight PLan). may registration marking aircraft ICAO designator aircraft operating agency followed flight identification adep_icao ICAO location identifier Airport Departure (ADEP) ades_icao ICAO location identifier Airport Destination (ADES) eobt Estimate Take-Date Time (EOBT), estimated time aircraft commence movement associated departure longitude longitude (decimal degrees) latitude latitude  (decimal degrees) flight_level flight level aircraft. Flight levels surfaces constant atmospheric pressure related specific pressure datum, 1013.2 HP (Hecto-Pascal). expression `Flight level times 100' sometimes, quite correctly, referred altitude feet track_service Determines whether CPR first (Begin), intermediate (Continuing) last (End) CPR sent corresponding system relevant flight. (Begin_And_End also possible) ssr_code 4-Digit octal code used transponder identify aircraft (SSR Mode 3/). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aviation_transponder_interrogation_modes track_speed calculated ground velocity (knots) based previous radar position track_heading calculated heading aircraft respect magnetic North (decimal degrees) climb_rate Climb (positive) descend (negative) rate (knots) track_vertical_mode categorical value rate climb, can one CLIMB, DESCENT, LEVEL_FLIGHT UNDETERMINED ifps_id unique flight plan identifier assigned IFPS system aircraft_address unique identification aircrafts frame (24-bit ICAO aircraft address)

title: Sample Correlated Position Report (CPR) data. — cprs

title: Calculate the cumulative distance (in km). — cumulative_distance
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cumulative_distance(poss) # calculate only the flown distance # NOTE: there is a gap in FR24 data between last ground position (if any) #       and first in air one (typically at ~1500 ft). #       The following code would certainly work better #       would poss contain a position report for a very low altitude. cumulative_distance(poss %>% filter(altitude > 0)) } # }

title: Export point profile from NM trajectories — export_model_trajectory
code: export_model_trajectory(   wef,   til,   model = "CTFM",   bbox = NULL,   lobt_buffer = c(before = 28, after = 24),   timeover_buffer = NULL )

title: Export point profile from NM trajectories — export_model_trajectory
text: wef (UTC) timestamp LOBT Effect (included). Liberal format, .e. "2019-07-14", "2019-07-14 10:21" "2019-07-14T10:21:23Z" til (UTC) timestamp LOBT TILl instant (excluded) model model profile: one CPF, CTFM, DCT, FTFM, SCR, SRR, SUR [default: "CFTM"]. bbox (Optional) axis aligned bounding box (xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) lobt_buffer (Optional) number (portion ) hours buffer LOBT /wef til (, ). cater flights crossing wef til. example c(= 24, = 2.25) allows retrieve flights LOBT 24H wef 1H15M til potentially crossing interval. timeover_buffer (Optional) number (portion ) hours buffer time_over /wef til (, ). cater flights crossing wef til. example c(= 2, = 0.25) allows retrieve points 2H wef 15M til.

title: Export point profile from NM trajectories — export_model_trajectory
text: dataframe trajectory data

title: Export point profile from NM trajectories — export_model_trajectory
text: need store credentials access PRU tables following environment variables: PRU_DEV_USR user id PRU_DEV_PWD password PRU_DEV_DBNAME database name

title: Export point profile from NM trajectories — export_model_trajectory
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # export 1 day worth of NM (planned) trajectories export_model_trajectory("2019-07-14", "2019-07-15", model = "FTFM")  # export 2 hours of NM (flown) trajectories export_model_trajectory("2019-07-14 22:00", "2019-07-15")  # export 1 day of NM (flown) trajectories export_model_trajectory("2019-07-14", "2019-07-15", lobt_buffer = c(before = 24, after = 1.25))  # export all CTFM trajectories within a bounding box 40 NM around EDDF bb <- c(xmin = 7.536746, xmax = 9.604390, ymin = 49.36732, ymax = 50.69920) export_model_trajectory("2019-01-01 00:00", "2019-01-02 00:00", bbox = bb) } # }

title: Identify and filter outliers — filter_outlier
text: col values processed median (.e. low pass) filter get .<col>_median, squared differences .<col>_eps2, mean .<col>_sigma. col value considered outlier .<col>_eps2 greater .<col>_sigma.

title: Identify and filter outliers — filter_outlier
code: filter_outlier(df, col, ksize, fill, keep = FALSE)

title: Identify and filter outliers — filter_outlier
text: df data frame trajectory data col variable filter outliers ksize kernel size (must odd) fill whether substitute outlier median keep whether keep intermediate results

title: Identify and filter outliers — filter_outlier
text: data frame corrected outliers (fill TRUE). keep TRUE intermediate columns .<col>_median, .<col>_eps2, .<col>_sigma .<col>_outlier included.

title: Identify and filter outliers — filter_outlier
text: approach inspired (copied ;-) filter function Xavier Olive's Python library traffic.

title: Identify and filter outliers — filter_outlier
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(readr) library(dplyr) library(anytime) library(trrrj) library(ggplot2)  ifile <- system.file("extdata", "belevingsvlucht.csv", package = "trrrj") df <- readr::read_csv(ifile) %>%   mutate(timestamp = anytime::anytime(time, tz = "UTC")) df1 <- df %>%   filter_outlier(col = baroaltitude, ksize = 17, fill = TRUE, keep = FALSE) ggplot() +   geom_line(data = df,  mapping = aes(x = timestamp, y = baroaltitude), colour = "blue") +   geom_line(data = df1, mapping = aes(x = timestamp, y = baroaltitude), colour = "red") } # }

what: Retain only positions within a range from a location. — filter_positions_at_range
title: Retain only positions within a range from a location. — filter_positions_at_range
text: points whose distance, .distance, satisfies $$dm <= .distance < dM$$ kept (.exclude = FALSE) excluded (.exclude = TRUE)

title: Retain only positions within a range from a location. — filter_positions_at_range
code: filter_positions_at_range(   df,   geo,   dm,   dM,   lon,   lat,   .exclude = FALSE,   .keep = FALSE )

title: Retain only positions within a range from a location. — filter_positions_at_range
text: df (trajectory) data frame geo geographical location lon/lat (WGS84) dm distance Nautical Miles dM distance Nautical Miles lon column longitude df lat column latitude df .exclude exclude point (dm, dM) [default FALSE] .keep keep calculated distance (Nautical Miles) .distance column [default FALSE]

title: Retain only positions within a range from a location. — filter_positions_at_range
text: subset df

title: Retain only positions within a range from a location. — filter_positions_at_range
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ fra <- c(8.570556, 50.03333) # Frankfurt Airport (longitude, latitude)  # keep the points 40 NM from FRA poss %>% filter_positions_at_range(fra, 0, 40, longitude, latitude) # keep the points from 10 to 40 NM from FRA poss %>% filter_positions_at_range(fra, 10, 40, longitude, latitude) # exclude the points from 10 to 40 NM from FRA poss %>% filter_positions_at_range(fra, 10, 40, longitude, latitude, .exclude = TRUE) # keep the points further away of 40 NM from FRA poss %>% filter_positions_at_range(fra, 0, 40, longitude, latitude, .exclude = TRUE) } # }

what: Parse latitude in ICAO format — parse_lat_icao
title: Parse latitude in ICAO format — parse_lat_icao
text: format described ICAO Doc 8126 section 5.5.2 bullet d): typical AIP pubblications additional part decimal seconds, like 554718.23N.
code: In the indication of the geographical coordinates of   a location:   - the latitude should be given first;   - symbols for degrees, minutes or seconds should     be omitted;   - two digits should always be used in expressing     values of less than 10 degrees of latitude; and   - three digits should always be used in expressing     values of less than 100 degrees of longitude.   For example, 050735N 0652542W means five   degrees, seven minutes and thirty-five seconds   North, sixty-five degrees, twenty-five minutes and   forty-two seconds West.

title: Parse latitude in ICAO format — parse_lat_icao
Parse latitude in ICAO format — parse_lat_icao
text: lat string representation latitude, .e. 554718N 554718.23N

title: Parse latitude in ICAO format — parse_lat_icao
text: latitude decimal degrees

title: Parse latitude in ICAO format — parse_lat_icao
text: format used AIP pubblications, examples runway threshold coordinates, stand positions, etc. used also ALL_FT+ files NM.

title: Parse latitude in ICAO format — parse_lat_icao

For example, 050735N 0652542W means five   degrees, seven minutes and thirty-five seconds   North, sixty-five degrees, twenty-five minutes and   forty-two seconds West.

title: Plot the recorded positions of a flight on a map. — plot_flight_horizontal
text: poss dataframe position reports (least) callsign, timestamp (date-time), altitude (feet), longitude (decimal degrees) latitude (decimal degrees) columns bbox bounding box format c(lowerleftlon, lowerleftlat, upperrightlon, upperrightlat). buffer number nautical miles (NM) around bounding box (default 40) legend.position legend position per ggplot2 (default "none", .e. show ). shape shape point plot (default NULL, .e. plot positions, paths). See shape geom_point. ... Extra parameters pass .

text: ggplot2 plot object.

title: Plot the recorded positions of a flight on a map. — plot_flight_horizontal
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(dplyr)  # define the bounding box of interest europe <- c(left = 5, bottom = 35, right = 30, top = 52) plot_flight_horizontal(poss, europe) plot_flight_horizontal(poss, buffer = 10) # 10km around the values  # from DB to plot p <- export_flights_at_airport_fr24("2017-09-01T00:00:00Z",                                     "2017-09-02T00:00:00Z",                                     "SVG",                                     5.638, 58.877) %>%   # NOTE: convert till DB columns are properly changed   mutate(longitude = as.numeric(LON), latitude = as.numeric(LAT)) %>%   select(FLIGHT_ID, EVENT_TIME, longitude, latitude)  f <- export_flights_at_airport_fr24("2017-09-01T00:00:00Z",                                     "2017-09-02T00:00:00Z",                                     "SVG",                                     flow = "ARR") %>%   rename(callsign = CALLSIGN) %>%   select(FLIGHT_ID, callsign)  p1 <- p %>% left_join(f) %>% filter(!is.na(callsign)) plot_flight_horizontal(p1) } # }

what: Sample FlightRadar24's archived feed ADS-B position reports data. — poss
title: Sample FlightRadar24's archived feed ADS-B position reports data. — poss
text: dataset containing FlightRadar24's archived ADS-B position reports (combined flight information flts) 41 flights. 20 flights 5th 21 6th Feb 2017.

title: Sample FlightRadar24's archived feed ADS-B position reports data. — poss
Sample FlightRadar24's archived feed ADS-B position reports data. — poss
text: data frame 9290 rows 19 variables. variables joint flight information flts following ones: flight_id unique identifier flight leg (integer) timestamp datetime position report (convertion  snapshot_id) snapshot_id time sample number seconds elapsed since 00:00:00 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), Thursday, 1 January 1970 altitude altitude feet (integer), supplied Mode-S ADS-B transponder heading degrees North, 0-359, (integer), data supplied ADS-B calculated mode-S transponders tracked using multi-lateration (MLAT) latitude latitude decimal degrees, data supplied ADS-B calculated mode-S transponders tracked using multi-lateration (MLAT) longitude longitude decimal degrees, data supplied ADS-B calculated mode-S transponders tracked using multi-lateration (MLAT) radar_id unique identifier primary ground receiver speed ground speed knots (integer), data supplied ADS-B calculated mode-S transponders tracked using multi-lateration (MLAT) squawk code broadcast airplane represented four octal digits, data supplied directly mode-S ADS-B transponder aircraft_id mode-S address hexadecimal, supplied Mode-S ADS-B transponder reg unique aircraft identifier (text) equip aircraft type (e.g. B733, per ICAO classification?), GLID gliders, GROUND ground vehicles callsign e.g. CSA190, supplied Mode-S ADS-B transponder flight flight number, e.g. OK190 schd_from IATA code scheduled departure airport schd_to IATA code scheduled arrival airport real_to IATA code actual arrival airport (diverted) date date flight (ones crossing midnight?)

title: Read Network Manager's archived CPR file — read_cpr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # read CPR's of the 20 sample flights for 5th Feb 2017 cprs_file <- system.file("extdata",                         "1.201702051001tacop304ARCHIVED_OPLOG_ALL_CPR.gz",                         package = "trrrj") cprs05 <- read_cpr(cprs_file) } # }

what: Read FR24's archived flights information for a day. — read_flights_fr24
title: Read FR24's archived flights information for a day. — read_flights_fr24
text: read_flights_fr24 returns flights archived FR24 given day (see path parameter date encoded).

title: Read FR24's archived flights information for a day. — read_flights_fr24
Read FR24's archived flights information for a day. — read_flights_fr24
text: path filename <yyyymmdd>_flights<eventually>.csv file. <yyyymmdd> part path's basename extracted date field.

title: Read FR24's archived flights information for a day. — read_flights_fr24
text: data frame archived flights flown <yyyymmdd>. flight following attributes (optional, .e. eventually empty,  flight_id): date         date flight flight_id    unique decimal identifier flight leg aircraft_id  mode-S address hexadecimal reg unique   aircraft text identifier equip        equipment, e.g. B733 callsign     callsign, e.g. NAX11S flight       flight number, e.g. DY311 schd_from    IATA code scheduled departure airport, e.g. KKN schd_to      IATA code scheduled arrival airport real_to      IATA code actual arrival airport (diverted)

title: Read FR24's archived flights information for a day. — read_flights_fr24
text: flights listed ones known FR24 fitting bounding box contractually agreed.

title: Read FR24's archived flights information for a day. — read_flights_fr24
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # flights, as recorded by FR24, on 20170205 (5th Feb 2017) flt_fr24_file <- system.file("extdata",                          "20170205_flights.csv",                          package = "trrrj") read_flights_fr24(flt_fr24_file) } # }

what: Read FR24's archived positions information for a flight. — read_positions_fr24
title: Read FR24's archived positions information for a flight. — read_positions_fr24
text: read_positions_fr24 returns position reports archived FR24 given flight_id flown specific day (see path parameter date flight ID encoded).

title: Read FR24's archived positions information for a flight. — read_positions_fr24
Read FR24's archived positions information for a flight. — read_positions_fr24
text: path filename <yyyymmdd>_<flight_id>_positions.csv file

title: Read FR24's archived positions information for a flight. — read_positions_fr24
text: data frame archived flight's positions date <yyyymmdd>. position report following attributes (mandatory, .e. non empty, speed, squawk vert_speed): flight_id   FR24 unique (within day?) flight leg identifier timestamp   snapshot_id converted date/time snapshot_id time sample Unix epoch seconds, .e. since 1st Jan 1970 00:00:00 UTC altitude    altitude (feet). Barometric relative ISO 1013 hPa pressure flight, always 0 ground. heading     0-359 degrees latitude    latitude decimal degrees longitude   longitude decimal degrees radar_id    unique identifier primary ground receiver speed       ground speed (knots) squawk      code broadcast airplane, represented four octal digits vert_speed  vertical speed (feet/min). Calculated rate altitude changes, 0 level flight empty unavailable on_ground   1 ground, 0 airborne. Calculated low altitude ground speed

title: Read FR24's archived positions information for a flight. — read_positions_fr24
text: positions listed ones known FR24 fitting bounding box contractually agreed.

title: Read FR24's archived positions information for a flight. — read_positions_fr24
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # positions, as recorded by FR24, for flight 207535493 on 20170205 (5th Feb 2017) pos_fr24_file <- system.file("extdata",                              "20170205_positions",                              "20170205_207535493.csv",                              package = "trrrj") read_positions_fr24(pos_fr24_file) } # }

Tidy eval helpers — tidyeval
text: enquo() delays execution one several function arguments. enquo() returns single quoted expression, like blueprint delayed computation. expr() quotes new expression locally. mostly useful build new expressions around arguments captured enquo() enquos(): expr(mean(!!enquo(arg), na.rm = TRUE)). as_name() transforms quoted variable name string. Supplying something else quoted variable name error. as_label() transforms kind R object, including quoted function calls vectors, string. purpose summarise object single label. label often suitable default name. know quoted expression contains (instance expressions captured enquo() variable name, call function, unquoted constant), use as_label(). learn tidy eval use tools, visit https://tidyeval.tidyverse.org Metaprogramming section Advanced R.

title: trrrj: Flight trajectories analysis — trrrj-package
text: Functions ) read FlightRadar24's live feed JSON files, archived data; b) import CPR data NM's archived files; c) Plot 2D trajectories, vertical profiles time track distance; d) analyse trajectories.
